w:r.w:t: The purpose of this document is to provide
design, testing, commissioning and maintenance of the anti surge protection systems for centrifugal or axial compressors
, Base Chemicals and Polymers operated sites.
ding to contractual terms for non-operated sites (joint ventures)
The main components of anti-surge system are
MSR – A3 - Anti surge protection system commissioning (for new project / compressor revamp / change of the anti-surge system)
MSR – A3 - Dry test prior surge protection mapping
MSR – A3 - Live test surge protection mapping
MSR – A3 - Anti-surge protection verification during maintenance
Instrumentation pre com, commissioning and start-up
Preventive maintenance of DCS, PLC and S PLC

: a compressor section means that the gas enter through one inlet of the compressor casing; passes through a series of impellers, then is discharged through one outlet of the compressor casing and then go to a heat exchanger. A compressor casing can have one or two sections.

: a compressor side stream can be “in” or “out”, it allows the capability to admit or discharge gas at intermediate pressure level as required by the process. Examples are for the refrigeration propylene compressors.
: can be called surge protection line, safety line or recycle trip line. Line between SLL and SCL where the anti surge valve is open by a step or fully open
: Line composed with several point in parallel of the SLL where the anti surge system should maintain the compressor flow as a minimum
: The volume flow capacity bellow which a centrifugal compressor starts to surge
: Line composed with several point of surge flow at different speeds
essential practices to ensure equipment integrity

w:r.w:delText: recognized as important in improving equipment availability and reliability.

w:r.w:t: The surge phenomenon in a centrifugal compressor i
s similar to an aircraft stall.
The compressor flow will decrease till a flow reversal, causing a discharge pressure decrease.
An increase in the process resistance will induce a discharge pressure
Map example extract from vendor CCC manual
An operating point is reached where the gas has insufficient velocity to overcome the rise in pressure
: a reverse flow is created through the machine. It continues until the system volume

along the reverse part of the performance curve until a point is reached where the flow direction returns to normal. The compressor then begins to refill the system volume downstream of the compressor and the pressure rise increases until
In the beginning of the surge phenomenon
some flow instability appears with minor pressure fluctuation
a deep surge can occur: the flow reverses through the machine and generate
discharge pressure fluctuations of very high amplitude
and high sub synchronous vibrations level.
Surge is characterized by violent changes in the mass flow of the machine with highly increased noise, vibration and violent rotor axial movement.
The factor / process parameters that generate a surge event are:
Rotor axial movement from inactive to active side in cycle
is low the radial vibration may not trip the machine in case of surge
around 50 to 80% of the machine rotation. Surge in diffuser is
In order to prevent surge, an anti-surge control system is checking in real time
, speed and when the compressor operating point
the surge area by crossing the “control line” an anti-surge valve
open in order to maintain compressor flow / pressure ratio to a minimum value preventing the surge event.
Normal Proportional and Integral Control Action

if the controlled valve opening is not sufficient. When the operating point reach the “backup line” (sometime also called recycle trip line) the anti surge valve is open by a fixed step as example 20%.
In case a sudden and rapid process change and if the controlled valve opening is not sufficient. When the operating point
the operating point approaching the control line.
The requirement of the system response
How often the anti-surge valve is
How quickly process changes are happening: gas composition, speed,
How much energy is wasted by having surge controllers set to 5 or 10 or more
In the particular case of high discharge volume
and high discharge pressure can generate a
a hot by pass valve can be implemented in parallel of the anti surge valve.
In case of multiple sections, each compressors section shall be protected. This will require individual protection for each section or global protection by group of section.
nti-surge system is a control system. This is not a safety system, except for axial compressor.
Map example extract from vendor CCC manual
Maintain the compressor away from the surge area
Communication with process controller to avoid conflicting actions
shall have an anti surge protection system
Each section of a centrifugal compressor shall have an anti surge protection system. Exception can be done for the multiple stage
compressor where several section can be protected with one anti surge protection system.
Particular case of Hydrogen recycle compressor
In some case the recycle compressor are not provided with anti surge protection system. By design of the process loop it was stated that surge events / situation were
A review of the train history shall be performed, at least 2 years before a scheduled turn around to evaluate the risks a
ssociated with the lack of anti-
valuate the benefice of an anti-
This is based on experience feedback for NOR hydrogen recycle compressor 90K103. As per original design, ASV loop was
. Following surge experience in 2006 an ASV loop had been implemented during the 2012 turnaround.
surge system shall be either upgraded or replaced before becoming obsolete.
The choice of the technology shall be assessed at the beginning of the project using
the general specification GS-RC-INS-720 and its annex 5.
At the beginning of the project, a vendor list shall be approved by IND/TEC/MMT and IND/TEC/

The process piping volume at compressor discharge before the check valve needs to be reduced to minimum. Especially at high pressure this volume will generate a loop response for the gas going back to the compressor suction.
inear flow characteristic is preferred for control loop response (rather than quick opening)
) should be enough to handle the full flow of the compressor and limited
to avoid bringing the compressor into choke
or the old design the valve were sized just for the compressor minimal
in the limit of the right side of the performance curve just before overload / chok
Map example extract from vendor CCC manual
valve needs to open in less than 2 second by command and less than 1 second by solenoid action (pneumatic boosters might be required in order to achieve these times).
Without more than 0.4s of time delay and without significant overshoot.
In order to achieve this performance
to be sufficient and air accumulator might be necessary.
A continuous position indicator shall be installed (in order to detect any abnormal opening of the valve) (This feedback may be given by a smart

The air instrument pressure shall be indicated on a panel located near to the air regulator. Design of the valves for response time shall be realized with value of the minimum air instrument pressure of the network.
These valves shall be equipped with smart
valve should be located at a high point in order to avoid condensate / liquid accumulation
These critical valves shall be accessible for maintenance purposes.
, the risk analysis should confirm the fail safe position.
R – the anti-surge pipe loop should not contain isolating valve in order to prevent any blockage of the loop.
Except if an HAZOP authorize it.
Field transmitters: Ps, Ts, Pd, Td, FT, speed
The transmitters need to be located as close as possible of the source of the measurements.
The transmitter response time should be fast
Response time for flow transmitter should be between 100 and 150 ms and no more than 200
Response time for pressure transmitter of 300 to 400 ms is acceptable
The impulse lines need to be as short as possible without low point.
For the flow transmitter LP and HP impulse line need to be of the same size.
If required impulse line need to be insulated and heat traced
suitable for the process application and shall be
at the beginning of the project phase. It need
analog input signals for suction flow
, suction pressure, suction temperature, discharge pressure and discharge temperature. The anti-surge controller shall use these inputs to calculate deviation from the compressor surge control line
shall calculate compressor operating point deviations in a manner that is unit-less
in order to limit suction condition
gas composition (molecular weight and specific heat ratio)
and switch to a back-up controller and generate an alarm.

nti-surge controller shall recognize transmitter failures and automatically switch to a fallback strategy, which shall allow continuing operation. Controller shall generate alarm, indicating failure of field transmitters.

The controller shall remain in fallback position until the instrument fault has been fixed or the instrument replaced and all test and calibration activities had been completed for the instrument replacement.
for Axial Compressor shall be in a dedicated system in line with API requirement.
of the recycle valves. If due to process changes the operating point comes t
the controller must automatically switch back to automatic mode.
Anti-surge Controller system shall operate its respective
) to maintain an adequate but not excessive margin of safety between the compressor section operating point and the surge limit. Under normal operating conditions the
nti-surge controllers shall produce dynamic control response in case of both slow/minor and large/very fast disturbances. For multi
section compressors, anti-surge controllers shall utilize a dedicated surge control algorithm for each
section. Anti-surge controller shall have the facility for limiting control of both discharge and suction pressure (configurable), consistent with the primary goal of preventing surge.

configuration shall be based on the compressor characteristics expected from the compressor manufacturers. The configuration parameters shall eventually be determined and adjusted from the compressor manufacturer’s shop performance tests and from subsequent field compressor surge protection tests.

s impacting the compressor (like process controller)
in order to link action of both systems. Also in case of multi section compressor, the anti-surge controller
R –the anti-surge controller should have a HMI display including:
Faults diagnostic tools (transmitter fault, failures, fallback view, …)
anti-surge system shall provide a visual display of the operating point on the compressor performance map
(for new project / compressor revamp / change of the anti-surge system)
surge system should have been tested during a FAT
range verification from controller and DCS.
Assistance of the anti-surge controller representative is
used by the anti-surge controller should
directly to the controller without transit via a DCS / PLC
in order to reduce time scan.
Dry test prior surge protection mapping
on site for slope, length, low point
Correct air supply pressure and piping size checked
Valve closed position should be maintain
% in order to get a correct valve sealing in operation
To check the valve opening dial gauge or valve stem
should be feel by hand (visual check is not sufficient)
Opening time from controller demand should be bellow 2s
Opening time from solenoid action should be bellow 1s
Closing should be smooth without overshoot
Absence of hard point during ramp open and ramp close
Multiple opening / closing should not collapse the instrument air pressure
/ command to be checked from the controller
Solenoid action to be checked from the controller
he last compressor map surge point
controller. A particular care need to be
Dry test of the surge protection system should perform
Operating points to be compared between compressor
Controller actions should be checked in dry test of start
replace by a spool piece plus orifice replacing the ASV in place
Exception can be done for the ASV replacement if the pipe cleanliness is sure and documented (
This test is not described in that GM.
In case of revamp changing process or recycle loop, the pipe cleaning shall be done prior the mechanical run. The mechanical run can be performed with the ASV in place.
All pre com and commissioning activities before surge protection mapping should be completed.
provided and attached to the surge test report.
Presence of compressor OEM and anti
The compressor OEM or the anti-surge controller OEM should prepare the surge mapping procedure.
of compressor flow and radial vibration to be installed for the live test in order to detect pre surge instability.
Check the process loop to be used for ASV tests.
Check that gas coolers are tuned and in automatic position with the right settings
Surge protection margin to be increased from 10 to 20% in flow prior test
Anti-surge valve forced open from controller
Refer to annex 2 for typical surge mapping procedure
In case of multi section compressor,
forced fully open. As an example the test can start with the
pressure section followed by the second section.
training should be programmed during the project phase. At least one person on site should be trained on the anti-surge protection system.
In addition of a trained person on site, service contract can be subscribe with
anti surge protection OEM for assistance by phone and spare parts.
performed either on the compressor, anti surge protection system and
the surge map verification is not required.
The anti-surge valve needs to be checked /
The overhaul should be performed with the proper valves tips for the settings and following the proper valve overhaul procedure.
the overhaul, test certificate should be supply with the valve.
Once the valve is installed back on site:
Correct air supply pressure and piping size checked
Valve closed position should be maintain till 2-3% in order to get a correct valve sealing in operation
To check the valve opening dial gauge or valve stem movement should be feel by hand (visual check is not sufficient)
Opening time from controller demand should be bellow 2s
Opening steps should be without significant overshoot
Opening time from solenoid action should be bellow 1s
Closing should be smooth without overshoot
Absence of hard point during ramp open and ramp close
Multiple opening / closing should not collapse the instrument air pressure
Valve demand / command to be checked from the controller deviation should be below 5%
Solenoid action to be checked from the controller /
Typical single stage compressor anti surge protection system
Typical two stage compressor with one overall anti surge protection system
Typical refrigeration compressor with side stream
Typical CO compressor CO with two overall anti surge protection system for four section (source CCC)
PID example of ERC compressor with three anti surge protection loop system for three section (source TOTAL)
Start compressor at minimal governor speed.
While speed is maintain at MSG:
Set Flow 10% away from Surge control line
closing the ASV till the controller takes the lead.
Check the response of the AS loop and the tuning of AS controller PID.
Make Frequency Analysis for compressor radial vibration probes.
Set Flow on Surge control line (
) by reducing the safety margin from 20 to 10%
Verify, when reducing the flow that Vibrations are below Alarm level and no evidence of
ub synchronous vibrations instability, then record Performance data, plot the point on the predicted test curves (Pd/Flow, Power/Flow)
Trend the suction pressure + the flow signal to observe any pre-surge instability.
Set Flow on Surge back-up line (
) by reducing the safety margin from 10 to 5%:
Set flow at 1% on the left hand side of the surge Control Line.
Vibrations on radial and axial bearing
If no sign of instability, go 1 more percent away from Surge Control line, monitoring the here-above parameter.
When running point is 5% away from Surge Control line, left hand side, and no sign of instability is detected, SCL is validated and compressor is considered as well protected.
During this check, if any sign of instability is detected, open ASV 100% or by de-activating the solenoid valve. Set Surge Control Line 10% away from instable running point detected.
Increase compressor speed to a mid speed point
Check the response of the AS loop and the tuning of AS controller.
Increase compressor speed to MCOS or maximum allowable speed according to process limitation (pressure temp) or driver power or compressor speed.
Check the response of the AS loop and the tuning of AS controller.
